Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Gummy \Gum"my\, a. [Compar. {Gummer} (?); superl. {Gummirst}.] Consisting of gum; viscous; adhesive; producing or containing gum; covered with gum or a substance resembling gum. [1913 Webster]
Kindles the gummy bark of fir or pine. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
Then rubs his gummy eyes. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
{Gummy tumor} (Med.), a gumma. [1913 Webster]
gummy adj : having the properties of glue [syn: {gluey}, {glutinous}, {mucilaginous}, {pasty}, {sticky}, {viscid}, {viscous}] [also: {gummiest}, {gummier}]
